Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark

Class Statistics

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Statistics
public class Statistics extends Object
The Statistics class is designed to analyze and store statistical data for a series of numerical values. This class calculates statistical measures such as total, mean, standard deviation, and a normalized mean based on the specified normalizing function.

  • Field Details

    • NORMALIZER_LINEARITHMIC_NATURAL

      public static final Function<Double,Double> NORMALIZER_LINEARITHMIC_NATURAL
      A pre-defined linearithmic normalizer function that applies the operation Math.log(x) * x to a given input value of type Double.

      This function is useful for normalizing or scaling numerical data according to a linearithmic scheme, which combines logarithmic and linear growth properties.

      It is expressed as a functional mapping: For an input x > 0, the function computes x * log(x).

      Note: The input must be a positive number (x > 0) as natural logarithm is undefined for zero or negative values. Providing such values will result in a runtime exception.

  • Constructor Details

    • Statistics

      public Statistics(String property, Function<Double,Double> normalizer, int nRuns, int size)
      Constructor for Statistics.
      Parameters:
      property - the particular property we're keeping track of.
      normalizer - the normalizer for the results (for example 1/n lg n).
      nRuns - the number of runs.
      size - the size of the problem.

  • Method Details

    • normalizedMean

      public double normalizedMean()
      Computes the normalized mean value for the data set represented by this Statistics instance. The normalization is achieved by dividing the mean of the data by the value obtained after applying the normalizer function to the size of the data set.
      Returns:
      the normalized mean of the dataset, calculated as mean() / normalizer.apply((double) size).

    • add

      public void add(double x)
      Adds a specified value to the internal data structure of this Statistics instance. Expands the storage if necessary and marks statistical calculations as stale.
      Parameters:
      x - the value to be added to the Statistics object.
      Throws:
      SortException - if the underlying data structure is empty.

    • getCount

      public int getCount()
      Retrieves the count of items or occurrences being tracked.
      Returns:
      the current count as an integer.

    • total

      public double total()
      Computes the total sum of all the elements in the array of doubles. If the total has already been calculated and cached, it returns the cached value. Otherwise, it calculates the total, caches it, and returns it.
      Returns:
      the total sum of the elements in the doubles array.

    • mean

      public double mean()
      Calculates the arithmetic mean by dividing the total value by the count.
      Returns:
      the calculated mean as a double. If the count is zero, this method will result in a division by zero exception.

    • stdDev

      public double stdDev()
      Computes and returns the standard deviation of the data stored in this Statistics object. The standard deviation is calculated using the formula: sqrt(sum((x - mean)^2) / count), where x represents each data point. The result is cached and subsequent calls return the cached value.
      Returns:
      the standard deviation of the data as a double.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the current state of the object. The representation includes the property, the number of elements, the mean, the standard deviation if applicable, and the normalized mean if the data has been updated. If the data has not been updated, the representation indicates that the values are unset.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string summarizing the object's state, including statistical details if available, or indicating unset state otherwise.
